Question: How is K.J. Somaiya College of Engineering, Sion?
Answer:
I live in Mumbai and after preparing for IIT-JEE since my 8th grade when I didn‚Äôt make it to IIT Bombay cut off for Computer Science Engineering (which has to be within AIR 56 nowadays to get into CSE at IIT Bombay or within top 500 ranks in the country to get any decent engineering at IIT Bombay), I was very disappointed.

I didn‚Äôt want to move out of Mumbai since having lived here all my life so applied to KJ Somaiya College of Engineering (KJSCE) at Vidyavihar and got an admit via CET cap admission rounds.

I would say KJSCE is among the best colleges in Mumbai. Back during my time it was under Mumbai University. Infrastructure-wise KJSCE is very good and has a large area of land. I think its second largest after the IIT Bombay campus because I don‚Äôt any other private college in Mumbai has that big of an area.

Most of my batch mates were like me who had been preparing for IIT JEE and hadn‚Äôt made it through. So I will say its safe to say for most of us, KJSCE was not a dream college but a secondary option incase we didn‚Äôt get into a tier one college like IIT, NIT or BITS.

Teaching faculty at KJSCE is mediocre and probably even the best engineering colleges in the world have mediocre teaching faculty because a college‚Äôs reputation and ranking is mainly on the quality of students they admit.

KJSCE has a minority quota for Gujarati‚Äôs, so you all will find many 50% admits are Gujjus and rest are merit admits. One or two are NRI/Gulf seats too.

Overall, I had a good time at KJSCE and made good friends. Most of my batch mates went to the US for Masters in CS or MIS and now working there only.

Question: Which one is better: the K.J. Somaiya College of Engineering or the Vivekanand Education Society's Institute of Technology?
Answer:
For your question the first thing you need to consider is the proximity of the college from our home (in case you don't plan to avail hostel facility) as on overall ranking basis many sources rank the two colleges quite close to each other and hence you'd really want to reduce your traveling time and focus more on your studies/other misc. activities.
Secondly, if traveling isn't an issue to you, you may consider the following points:


Infrastructure:Both colleges have an excellent infrastructures which you can see on their respective websites/visit them personally.
Placements:The average placements of both colleges lie around 3-3.5 lacs although there have been cases of some students getting about 24 lakh packages in kjsce recently (last year). Also some students secure out-of -campus placements which may go sky high like around 50lakhs. So its basically the students bio that matters in this scenario.

University:Here's the major difference where Kjsce definitely holds the upper hand. Vesit comes under Mumbai University whereas Kjsce has been an autonomous institute since the past two years (this year being the second batch of complete autonomy). How this helps is that the subjects are better designed for personal growth than in case of MU. Moreover, this allows the college to control the exam conduction which has definitely been better than MU. Also you get a longer vacation for extra curricular activities like projects/internships which come in handy highlighting your resume.
Sports:No comparison!Kjsce has an extremely well reputed football turf and a very good badminton court as well. Also the running track is in accordance with the university standards.

Campus: Kjsce has probably one of the biggest campuses as compared to nearby colleges in mumbai except for IIT-B which has way bigger one .

So basically its upto you which college you want to choose as both are pretty good colleges. Hope I was helpful. Cheers!

Question: What is the placement scenario at KJ Somaiya?
Answer:
If you're eager to carve out a successful path post-graduation, you've likely caught wind of the buzz surrounding KJ Somaiya's placement prowess. Let's dive into what this esteemed institution brings to the table in terms of career opportunities.

Recent Placement Highlights:

High Placement Rates: Picture this‚Äîa history of sky-high placement rates, with grads snagging dream jobs left, right, and center through campus placements. Sources like Collegedunia even tout a perfect 100% placement record for 2023‚Äînow, that's impressive!
Average Salary: Money matters, right? Well, Collegedunia suggests an average salary package hovering around ‚Çπ12.32 LPA for 2023 placements. Not too shabby, huh?
Reputed Recruiters: From IT giants to consulting moguls and everything in between, KJ Somaiya attracts the creÃÄme de la creÃÄme of recruiters. It's like a buffet of career opportunities waiting to be devoured.
Highest Package: But wait, there's more! While averages give you a ballpark figure, some students hit the jackpot with jaw-dropping offers. Keep an eye out for those highest package mentions‚Äîit's a glimpse into the realm of possibility for top performers.

Additional Factors to Consider:

Program and Specialization: The placement game isn't one-size-fits-all. Dive into program-specific details and specializations to understand how your chosen path fares in the job market.
Skill Development Focus: It's not just about the degree‚Äîit's about the skills you bring to the table. Look for initiatives and resources geared towards honing your talents and making you irresistible to recruiters.

Resources for Further Exploration:

KJ Somaiya Placement Website/Brochure: Dive into the treasure trove of placement reports, statistics, and alumni success stories. It's like a roadmap to your future career!
Contact Placement Cell: Got burning questions? Reach out to the placement cell directly‚Äîthey're your gateway to the latest placement data and insider insights.
Connect with Alumni: Who better to spill the tea on placement experiences than those who've been there, done that? Connect with alumni on LinkedIn for a firsthand peek into life post-KJ Somaiya.

So, there you have it‚Äîyour guide to navigating the placement scene at KJ Somaiya. With a little digging and some insider knowledge, you'll be on your way to securing that dream job in no time!

Question: When does K.J. Somaiya College of Engineering start its first semester, and how hard are the papers?
Answer:
Sorry for Answering late.

The first year syllabus for the core subject like, Mechanics, chemistry is pretty much the same as that of , in NEET/CET syllabus. So, you can start referring few of the topics from Physics CET books. (Say, Friction, Force and work etc.)

Kumbhojkar for Maths. Nice book, to the point. Enough questions. Revise basic algebra formule if u feel like.Most of the preparation can be done in Tutorials session.

Now, you can start studying for C/C++ classes if you are not familiar with this subjects any earlier. (I wasn't) .

There would be AUTO-CAD practicals, focus and try to learn as much as you can. The software is pretty important for professional life.

In second semester, you would have Engineering Drawing. If you get enough practice in college time itself ,great. If you can't, join classes. It would help you in Machine drawings, and later in Theory of Machines.

You can always study in the reading room. You can have maximum books availed from library.

And most importantly, ENJOY your first year. Join some cultural activity club. RHAPSODY (drama team) is the best one. Go to Illuminati sessions. It will help you in public speakings. Go to open bus ride, Symphony publicity. Build a BOT in abhiyantriki. Join MESA.

You would love everything at KJSCE.

All the best. :)

Question: What is the review of K.J. Somaiya College of Engineering (KJSCE) now in 2021 after it became a private university?
Answer:
Hi Ameya,

Being from the first autonomous batch in KJSCE from 2014-2018 I would say that the autonomous status for the college is great. The curriculum is better than Mumbai University. (MU)

This means that you can explore and learn new courses and work on the latest technologies rather than following the useless Techmax books which are old and of no use. The fees are comparatively more but as compared to the maintenance of the huge campus they seem quite satisfactory. Besides KJSCE has a strong network of alumni globally and many good universities abroad are already aware of the college which will help during your applications if you‚Äôre planning to opt for further studies after your engineering.

Talking about placements, more companies will come to recruit considering the past history and new courses that the students will be studying. So to conclude, the review of KJSCE is great and better than most of the normal MU engineering colleges out there currently in Mumbai. This will even set you apart as there are only a few universities in Mumbai which have the autonomous tag currently. Hope this helps, good luck with the admissions.

Question: What are the different types of scholarships available for the students enrolled in K.J. Somaiya College of Engineering?
Answer: I am a gujurati, so I had the benifit of Linguistic Minority. I had applied for admissions in KJSCE in the month of May, in the 4th round of admissions. I had applied through my JEE Mains score (74%tile) and I didn't get admission in any of the branch. After the MHT-CET results were declared I applied again in round 5 of admissions and I got Computer Engineering. I also got a scholarship of 45% I.e. Rs. 2L. I had scored 95.95%tile in CET. I had not applied for any scholarship during the admission process and it was granted to me based on few merit based conditions which I need to fulfill in the next 4 years to keep the scholarship. The conditions are very easy first is, have attendance of more than 75% and second is to maintain a CGPI of more than 7.0.

Question: Which branch should I choose, Electronics Engineering or Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering at K.J. Somaiya College of Engineering?
Answer:
I will answer you question in two part. I am myself an Electronics Engineer and I feel there is something people aspiring to join the Electronics domain should know about it.

You will surely regret taking this field if:

You can‚Äôt understand basic concepts of electrical circuits, elementary physics, mathematics and basic computer programming.
Have no interest in Electronics whatsoever and no interest in Engineering
You only want a job in this domain, without any hard work and relevant skills.

Secondly, you will have to see what your interest is. In Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering (say ENTC), you will be studying electronics circuits , signals and how to generate/analyze/detect/filter them, electronic devices; how do they operate and are manufactured, modern processor, controllers and how to develop basic systems with them. And many more topics like Control System theory, Electromagnetics etc. Why am mentioning all these ? Because understand that at the end of engineering you will be using this knowledge to step into electronics industries, or would be choosing one of the topics and going ahead with research or specialization.

Now I don‚Äôt know what people have told you, but from my experience, there is good demand of Electronics Engineers, especially in India. But note, we need competent engineers, not degree holders. ENTC engineering is not easy, and it involves concepts of computer science, electrical and sometimes mechanical engineering along with electronics. You need to study and understand the concepts involved and also how they are applied commercially. Once you are skilled in your domain, you can see that there are opportunities. There are even opportunities in startups if you are interested.

One reason why people might be telling you that there‚Äôs no scope and few jobs, may be because today there are too many CS/IT related jobs when compared to Electronics engineering (in India). Unfortunately today‚Äôs scenario is that many electronics engineers join IT industries. This is giving the impression that we don‚Äôt have jobs for electronics engineers. Comparatively, yes, jobs are less in Electronics domain when compared with CS/IT branch. But this doesn‚Äôt means you will regret taking Electronics. It just means that you will have to be more skilled than others, and look harder for company/organization that suits your interest.

SO check your interests, and go ahead. If you are interested, skilled and competent, then there are plethora of opportunities and exciting jobs waiting for you. You will never regret your decision. If you have interest in Electronics, there‚Äôs no better time than now to step in this domain. We are in the process of watching electronics revolutionize our lifestyle and you just might get a front row seat in this spectacular show.

Question: Can you share your experience of counselling at K.J. Somaiya College of Engineering (Mumbai)?
Answer:
It was after my boards that I have decided to pursue MBBS, alone. All my friends decided to take admission in different colleges.Then I Searched for coaching classes and joined the one I found best. All three subjects in different classes, all in separate corner of city. I used to go out early in the morning, attend one class, drive for about 30 minutes, attend second class, then study for few hours, then drive for another class. Then return home at the time of dinner, study, sleep then next day repeat. For almost 5 months it was my routine. For some last months I studied madly.

Then comes the result. I was allotted a private dental college. I was disappointed, frustrated and literally wanted to end everything. I told my parents. They told me to join college. I don't wanted to. I wanted to take one more attempt.They forced me to join college. For their sake I joined. But I wasn't happy nor excited. only 10 days went, and I was unable to continue.I used to sit alone, didn't talk to anyone, didn't gave efforts to any tasks in college. I don't no why but it became impossible for me to continue. I told my parents, this time my sister took my side and argued with them to allow me one more attempt. They finally agreed. I started preparing for next exam, and a lot tragedies happened after that but finally after 3rd attempt I got Medical college. Currently I am answering this in between preparation of anatomy paper of university exams.

Question: Is it worth doing an M.Tech from the K.J. Somaiya College of Engineering, Mumbai in CAD, CAM, and robotics?
Answer:
Very very (very) bad!

I'm passing out from KJSCE next month and I can surely tell you that the placement situation is extremely bad. Though I got placed in an education firm, it can't be considered as something which a mechanical engineer would hope for. I wanted to go in education so it doesn't matter to me.

I have seen my friends who want jobs so badly but aren't placed anywhere. I think only 3 or 4 core mechanical companies approached this year. As far as I know, about 11 people have been placed from my batch. Most of the companies are offering sales position which I don't think a core mechanical guy would like to go for. Other companies just expect you to know python or any language since they aren't mechanical companies.

So I'd like you to know that placement situation is extremely horrible right now at KJSCE. Please do proper homework before taking admission anywhere.

Question: What are the differences between K.J. Somaiya College of Engineering and VJTI Mumbai for computer science engineering? Can you justify which one is better and why?
Answer:
Key Differences between K.J. Somaiya College of Engineering and VJTI Mumbai for Computer Science Engineering

Placement Statistics:

VJTI: Average CTC: INR 12.5 LPA (2022) Highest CTC: INR 45 LPA (2022) Placement percentage: 98% (2022)
K.J. Somaiya: Average CTC: INR 8.5 LPA (2023) Highest CTC: INR 17 LPA (2023) Placement percentage: 95% (2023)

Faculty and Infrastructure:

VJTI: Experienced faculty with PhD and industry experience State-of-the-art laboratories and research facilities
K.J. Somaiya: Young and enthusiastic faculty with a focus on research Well-equipped labs and a dedicated research center

Industry Collaboration and Accreditation:

VJTI: Collaborations with top companies like Microsoft, Amazon, and Google Accredited by the National Board of Accreditation (NBA)
K.J. Somaiya: Partnerships with industry leaders like IBM and SAP Accredited by the National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC)

Research and Innovation:

VJTI: Strong focus on research, with significant publications in reputed journals Dedicated research center with modern equipment
K.J. Somaiya: Emerging research ecosystem, with a focus on collaborative projects Supports student participation in research and innovation initiatives

Which is Better?

Based on the latest data, VJTI Mumbai ranks higher than K.J. Somaiya College of Engineering for computer science engineering.

Reasons:

Superior Placement Statistics: VJTI has consistently higher average CTC, highest CTC, and placement percentage.
Experienced Faculty and Infrastructure: VJTI has a more established faculty with a proven track record and excellent research facilities.
Stronger Industry Collaboration: VJTI's established partnerships with leading companies provide students with valuable exposure and internship opportunities.
Higher Accreditation Status: VJTI is accredited by the higher-ranking NBA, which is recognized globally.

Question: What are the career options for mechanical engineering graduates from the K.J. Somaiya College of Engineering?
Answer:
I am Second year mechanical engineering student at K J Somaiya.

Life at K J somaiya is different than any other institute in Mumbai especially after autonomy.

Every Semester is about same with different subjects.
Teaching is good with some annoying professors.
Exam pattern changed a lot after autonomy. You get only one holiday for 1 subject so unlike the months in MU exam gets over in a week and half.
Study leave is shorter too so students must start studying during semester.
Plus point here is you get about 2 months of Vacation after your exam.
And you can actually see your assessed papers for free on open day.
Huge campus.
Great football ground, badminton court, table tennis, carrom etc. Easily accessible
Canteen is affordable with great food.


Getting to Mechanical Engineering


One of the best in the city for ME.
Crowd in Mechanical is generally smarter than other branches because of cutoff.
Gender ratio is really poor, only 6 grirls in about 80 students division.(not specific to this college though)
There's lots of things you can do with studying like joining a team which builds something. There's Orion Racing makes race car, Red shift Racing makes ATV, Onyx makes air crafts,Team Eta guys make fuel efficient cars.
And they are pretty great too Orion Racing won first price at JK tyre FDC 2015. Competing against top colleges in India.
If you don't want to join anything and want to make your own project you can do that too.


Will improve this aanswer as I can, suggestions are always welcome.

Question: Is K.J. Somaiya college good for mechanical Engineering?
Answer:
DJ Sanghvi College of Engineering (DJSCE)

Placements: The placement record of the college is pretty solid. Big companies like Tata, TCS, Infosys are frequent recruiters here. The highest reported package is around 60 lakhs per annum with an average being at around 7 lakhs.
Fees: The total tuition fee for DJ Sanghvi B.E. in Mechanical Engineering is INR 7.65 Lakh.
Student Opinion: Students have praised the college for its qualified faculty and state-of-the-art infrastructure. They also appreciate the college‚Äôs leniency compared to other colleges. However, some students have expressed dissatisfaction with the college‚Äôs cooperation in external activities.

KJ Somaiya College of Engineering (KJSCE)

Placements: The highest package was Rs 25 lakh per annum. The average package was 10.14 Lakhs.
Fees: The B.Tech fees at KJSCE range from Rs 4,32,000 to Rs 4,70,000 per annum.
Student Opinion: Students have appreciated the opportunities provided by the college for participating in committees and clubs. They also value the college‚Äôs faculty and infrastructure.

In conclusion, both colleges have their strengths. DJ Sanghvi has a strong placement record and is appreciated for its faculty and infrastructure. On the other hand, KJ Somaiya provides a wide range of opportunities for students to participate in extracurricular activities and also has a good placement record. So, it ultimately depends on what you value more in your education. Good luck with your decision! üçÄ

Question: What are the placement statistics for K.J. Somaiya College of Engineering and SJSCE in Nagpur?
Answer:
I don‚Äôt know about K. J. Somaiya, but being a student of D. J. Sanghvi, I can tell you about the placements in D. J. Sanghvi.

Your placements will start as soon as your 4th year starts. Morgan Stanley is usually the 1st company that visits the college. It provides the highest salary (14‚Äì16 lacs pa). I was fortunate enough to be placed in Morgan Stanley last year and I‚Äôll be starting my job soon.

The placements then go on for a year. About 35‚Äì40 companies visit the campus with salaries ranging from 3 to 12 lacs per annum. J. P. Morgan hires people through ‚ÄòCode For Good‚Äô, a 24-hour coding contest. Other reputed companies like ZS, Directi, Indus Valley, etc. visit the campus soon after Morgan Stanley. Many other companies like Halftick, EnY, Quantiphi, Dollat Capital, Mastek, Musigma, LTI, Deloitte, etc., visiting the campus, provide an appreciable salary. As far as I know, everyone in my division, who attended the placement process, have been placed in some or the other company. Mass recruiters like TCS, Infosys also visit the campus.

The placements are really good in D. J. Sanghvi, so you can do a job before you start thinking about your masters. You‚Äôll be provided with a lot of job opportunities, with varying job positions. Seniors are really helpful during the process as well.

Question: Which is better, Amity University or K.J. Somaiya College of Engineering and Technology?
Answer:
KJ Somaiya College of Engineering (KJSCE)

‚Ä¢ Affiliation: Affiliated with the University of Mumbai.

‚Ä¢ Status: Autonomous institution.

‚Ä¢ Reputation: Highly reputed for its academic standards and research opportunities.

‚Ä¢ Courses: Offers undergraduate and postgraduate programs in various engineering fields, including Computer Engineering, Electronics, and Mechanical Engineering.

‚Ä¢ Infrastructure: Modern and well-equipped with state-of-the-art facilities.

‚Ä¢ Placements: Known for strong placement records with high packages. In 2024, the highest package was INR 58 LPA and the average was INR 11.35 LPA.

‚Ä¢ Campus Life: Vibrant campus life with a range of student activities and organizations.

KJ Somaiya Institute of Engineering and Information Technology (KJSIEIT)

‚Ä¢ Affiliation: Also affiliated with the University of Mumbai.

‚Ä¢ Status: Un-aided institution (not autonomous).

‚Ä¢ Reputation: Well-regarded but generally considered to have a lower profile compared to KJSCE.

‚Ä¢ Courses: Offers undergraduate programs primarily in Computer Engineering, Information Technology, and Electronics.

‚Ä¢ Infrastructure: Good facilities, but may not be as extensive as those at KJSCE.

‚Ä¢ Placements: Offers good placement opportunities, but with lower packages compared to KJSCE. The average package is around INR 5-6 LPA, with the highest at INR 14.5 LPA as of 2023-24.

‚Ä¢ Campus Life: Active campus life with student events and organizations, though smaller in scale compared to KJSCE.

Summary

‚Ä¢ Autonomy: KJSCE is an autonomous institution with more flexibility in academics and curriculum, whereas KJSIEIT is not autonomous.

‚Ä¢ Reputation and Courses: KJSCE is generally considered to have a higher reputation and a broader range of advanced courses.

‚Ä¢ Placements: KJSCE has higher placement packages compared to KJSIEIT.

‚Ä¢ Infrastructure: KJSCE typically offers more extensive infrastructure and facilities.

KJSCE might be the better choice for those seeking a high-reputation institution with advanced academic and research opportunities, while KJSIEIT is a strong option for those looking for good engineering programs with a focus on placement opportunitie

Question: What are the advantages and disadvantages of studying at K.J. Somaiya College of Engineering, Mumbai? What kind of campus placements do they provide after graduation? Is the degree worth it?
Answer:
I have completed my electronics engineering from K.J. Somaiya so I consider myself eligible to answer this question.

The K.J. placement faculty would get offended with my below statement: Placements in K.J. are biased and more inclined towards Comps/I.T. branches.

Most of the companies that visit K.J. have their eligibility criteria set as only Comps/IT branches are allowed. Being an electronics engineer, you dream of getting placed in a core company. The dream gets thrashed when you realize there are only 5 odd core companies (companies looking for electronics engineer) that visit K.J. for recruitment. They recruit the cream students, your class toppers.

Being an average student, as I was, you are left with two options. Opt for off-campus placements or appear for interviews of Infosys and Accenture(Every year Infosys and Accenture collectively recruit 200 odd students from K.J.).

Don‚Äôt go by what the graphs say on K.J.‚Äôs website. They are meant to lure you. If you wish to work in an IT firm, K.J. is one of the best for placement. If you wish to work in an electronics company, better start looking for off-campus opportunities.

Question: What are the differences between K.J. Somaiya College and SIES College for an electrical engineer?
Answer:
Before you make a choice, I'd like to let you know that both colleges are great for the branches you've mentioned. But here are a few favtors that you should consider, before you decide :

KJ Somaiya is an autonomous Institution and is now a little more prestigious than the Mumbai University.
Attendance isn't strict in KJ as far as I know. It is pretty strict in Vivekanand.
Electronics and Telecommunications has an upper edge over pure electronics, period.
If you're in the Mumbai University, you don't have to worry much about your exams as it usually includes a big repetition of the previous year's papers. This is not the case in KJ. The papers are much harder and the exam schedules are way more hectic.
MU gives 5 days of holiday before every semester paper. KJ only gives one or two days. This makes the exams very hectic in KJ.

The semester ends in KJ before MU, as their papers get over very early. Kj students get as much as two months of leave after every semester whereas MU students get barely one month. One can use these vacations for doing internships and co curricular courses that have a positive effect on one's resume. However, I would like to mention that one month is sufficient for doing internships.

So basically, it is a pretty even match between the two. The deciding factor must be one's interest in a particular field. That makes a world of a difference. So you should listen to your heart and think whether the telecommunications part of the industry interests you more or core electronics.

To make it easier for you, I'll tell you a little bit about both the branches.

Both branches are very similar to each other.
The basic concepts are the same.
Electronics also has a few subjects of telecommunications such as Digital Communication, and vice versa.
However, electronics will teach you more about electronic components, circuits and more basic ideas needed in general electronics.
Telecommunications will try to give you a deeper perspective of communication technologies.

All the best! Hope this helps you make your choice.

Question: Which is the best college for an MCA in Maharashtra?

Question: Are there any good colleges for computer science in mumbai?
Answer:
*********************Long Detailed Answer Ahead*********************
A million dollar question like this requires some better answers and not just a list of colleges based on cut-offs and placement figures. This may help others as even I had the same questions when I decided to take CS in Mumbai. I have studied in Tier 2/3 college as people like to call it. But have friends across the city studying in various colleges. So my answer will be based on their experiences and my experiences. So here is a list, assuming question doesn‚Äôt specifically asks about Mumbai University.
IIT Bombay :
I don‚Äôt need to rant about IIT-B as the top most college in Mumbai and India for CS. If you get in then congrats and be prepared to work hard. But the thing that makes IIT-B stand apart is the crowd of students that go there.
The professors, curriculum, labs, seniors and good coding culture makes it a perfect combination for any CS student. And placements are well known across the country.

VJTI, KJSCE, SPIT [Autonomous Colleges]:
Veermata Jijabai Technological Institute [VJTI], K. J. Somaiya College of Engineering [KJSCE], Sardar Patel Institute of Technology [SPIT] are all best autonomous institutes in Mumbai and one of the best when it comes to comparison in Mumbai based colleges.

VJTI : This is a government college and cheapest amongst all the colleges in Mumbai. It‚Äôs been consistently ranked 1 in Mumbai for a lot of reasons but I take all rankings with a bag of salt. VJTI is so good because the toppers in state entrance exam come here and when you have the best talent in the state, your results are bound to be good. But the teachers are a real letdown as far as what I have heard. Labs are below average and location is good. Fees are very low at around Rs. 70,000 PA. It is often a top destination for the all the best companies like Microsoft,etc and the top packages often hover around 20‚Äì24LPA. And the alumni presence is strong everywhere. You get it, go for it.
KJSCE,SPIT : Both the colleges got autonomy in the recent years and have been performing good in all the departments. But be ready to burn a hole of approx Rs. 1.25 - 1.75 LPA for the fees. But if you get in, its mildly justifies the fees. Students are smart, placements are good. Teachers are good to average as like everywhere else. Also good in terms of placement and all the big names come here.

DJSCE,TSCE,FCRIT,VESIT [Mumbai University]:
Dwarkadas J. Sanghvi College of Engineering [DJSCE], Thadomal Shahani Engineering College [TSEC], Fr. Conceicao Rodrigues College of Engineering [FCRIT], Vivekanand Education Society's Institute of Technology [VESIT] are all Mumbai University affiliated colleges and are considered very good after the autonomous bunch above. These are good colleges where you can get a decent shot at good companies. The fees are in range of Rs. 1 ‚Äì 1.5 LPA which is average fees in Mumbai colleges.

DJSCE : They have grown in quality by leaps and bounds in a matter of years in all departments. And their committees and festivals are very good. Students are smart and teachers are mostly good. Placements are also top notch with the likes of JPMC, Morgan Stanley, etc. I even met a guy who got internship at Microsoft. So its going to catch up the lot above very soon.
TSEC : They have been the same all these years. Big name, good students and good placements with big names. Can‚Äôt go wrong with this one.
FCRIT : They have two campuses in Mumbai one in Bandra and the other in Vashi. I have friend in both the campuses. I‚Äôll speak for the Vashi campus first. My friend quotes it beautifully in one word; ‚ÄúJAIL‚Äù. Yes! That‚Äôs what people feel in Vashi campus. Hardly any freedom, very very strict attendance policies. Everyone is just focused on rote learning [*Maggus*] and very few are good. My suggestion is avoid this one if you want some degree of freedom in college. The Bandra campus is better but attendance is also strict here to varying degrees. The placements are average that‚Äôs what I‚Äôve heard. ‚ÄúGo here at your own risk.‚Äù
VESIT : Good college with good placements and haven‚Äôt heard anything highly negative about it.

TCET,ACE,SFIT,RGIT,VCET [Mumbai University] aka The Big Five:
Thakur College of Engineering and Technology [TCET], Atharva College of Engineering [ACE], St. Francis Institute of Technology [SFIT], Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Technology [RGIT], Vidyavardhini College of Engineering and Technology [VCET] are all colleges belonging to more or less the same clan. The thing that‚Äôs common in all of them is placements. The majority of the students get placed in the mass recruiter companies and hence they achieve good placement statistics. Without the mass recruiters, it will tough for them to place them, which true for rest of the colleges in Mumbai also. The fees ranges from Rs 93,000 - 1,30,000 which is in the low to average category. The students are a mixed bad in all these colleges with bright spots here and there.

TCET : The costliest in the lot but also good infrastructure in return. Has a name in the western suburbs and good placement record. I remember WorkApps had come here with a 30LPA pacakge and they selected one person. Most of the crowd gets placed in the mass recruiters here. But there are exceptions always, I knew some very good people in that college.
ACE : [*This can be a little biased view as I studied here*] ‚ÄúBang for the Buck‚Äù is what I could like to describe Atharva as it is one of the most affordable private colleges in Mumbai but the fees are rising every year. I write a whole answer on pros and cons of being here but I‚Äôll keep it short here. The CS department has a very good HOD and he supports the students in the department very well. There are various committees promoting good coding culture and seniors were good. Attendance is little lenient as compared to others and labs are super cool. Students vary a lot and this is a problem. Some are interested while others just come to do pass the time. But a huge potential in the department as all the teachers are good to average supporting students. [*I stop the rant here*]
SFIT : A close cousin of FRCIT with very strict attendance requirements of 75% which is a little harsh on the students. Teachers are average and so are the students. Nothing exceptional to speak for.
RGIT : This one was a good name in the past but the college has lost its shine becoming a stagnant college. I had friends here and as per them its nothing noteworthy. Teachers are ok and so are placements. Not so strict on the attendance front. Good to average infrastructure.
VECT : The lowest performing in the lot. Average to bad infrastructure. Average professors and nothing much to say about placements or students either. The college is good for Mechanical as that‚Äôs what I‚Äôve heard. Location is far from Mumbai but very near from the railway station.

Other noteworthy names in Mumbai include Vidyalankar Institute of Technology [VIT], Mukesh Patel School of Technology Management & Engineering [MPSTME], Shah & Anchor Kutchhi Engineering College [SAKEC], Ramrao Adik Institute of Technology [RAIT]

But there is a caveat to every college in the list. No matter whether you go to IIT-B or RGIT, you have the same amount of time and resources at your disposal. So only the college name will not get you to success, its your own hardwork that will get you there. Also having a small group of like minded friends affects a lot and helps you in developing yourself. I know people in VJTI who work in Microsoft as well as in Accenture. So take all the reviews and rankings with a bag of salt and just work hard in college. And most importantly, in CS internet is your biggest friend and biggest enemy. So you should chose carefully.
Good Luck.

P.S : Edits and constructive feedback to improve the list is most welcomed.

Question: I just got provisional admission in KJ Somaiya for computer engineering. Can you tell me the best of computer engineering and other best things about campus life, etc.?

4. KJSCE students can take part in many co-curricular activities and college fests lets us explore our skills apart from the academic interests.

5.We also have many councils/students associations/cultural teams ,which we can be part of, to help plan,organise and enjoy these fests.

I have recently answered a question on the experience one can gain being a part of KJSCE, so if you are interested for more information please do check it out.

What is your review of K. J. Somaiya College of Engineering?

Please keep visiting our website for more updates on admissions and SET-E 2020.

Hope this answers your question and all the best for your future endeavours!

Question: Which campus placement is the best in India?
Answer:
It is obviously and without doubt Chandigarh University !!

With the factor that Chandigarh University has set a new breathtaking record for more than 5000 + placements during the times when the whole world was battling the Covid and was under the condition of Lockdown, It has proved that no kind of condition can prevail to stop Chandigarh University from building and fulfilling such set records.

The successful Joint Placement Programmes (JPP) since 2015 have become a phenomenal annual event on the Chandigarh University campus, whereby, not only the students of Chandigarh University but students from all over Punjab, Chandigarh, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh, J&K, Rajasthan, Delhi and UP receive the benefit of being able to crack an offer and raise their chances of employability.

Over 627 Multi-National Companies like HCL, Tech Mahindra, TVS Motors, Jubilant Foods and L&T Infotech, who have conducted campus recruitment programs for the passing-out batch stand testimony to the success of this herculean effort. Students of all streams such as Engineering, MCA, MBA, Hotel Management, Bio-Technology, Airlines-Tourism, and Animation etc. got a chance to face the recruitment panel of multi-national companies.

Chandigarh University Engineering student bags 35 LPA package from US Multi-National Company - Times of India
Business News: (Eds: Disclaimer: The following press release comes to you under an arrangement with PRNewswire.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/chandigarh-university-engineering-student-bags-35-lpa-package-from-us-multi-national-company/articleshow/77145512.cms

Since its inception, Joint Placement Programme (JPP) of Chandigarh University (CU), has provided placement opportunities to more than 80,000 students of North India with more than 1000 Multi-Nationals having recruited students so far under the program.

After the success of Joint Placement Drives, Chandigarh University (CU) have opened online registrations for 2020 passing out batch. On-line applications are invited from students of Engineering, MCA, MBA, Hotel Management, Bio-Technology, Pharmacy and any other Graduation/ Post-Graduation all over India to apply for Joint Placement Programme.

A few highlights of previous JPP are:

CHANDIGARH UNIVERSITY CAMPUS PLACEMENT DRIVES HIGHLIGHTS

Record salary package offered of Rs. 35 LPA
691 Multi-Nationals recruited students of 2020 passing-out batch
Companies like HP, SAP Labs, Amazon visited Punjab for 4th time for campus placements
80,000 students of North India offered platform under JPP.

Engineering Placements Highlights

350 Multi-Nationals select 3750 Engineers during 2019-20
Companies offering 5 LPA or more salary package are 131+ with 650+ selections
Companies offering 10 LPA or more salary package are 26+ with 100+ selections
50+ MNCs among the Top 100 of India has made 500+ offers.
Top Fortune 500 Companies select Engineering students in Campus Placements (Microsoft, Amazon, Hewlett Packard, Bank of America, NOKIA, Deloitte, IBM, DELL, SAP Labs)
118 Core Engineering Companies select 1097 students from Mechanical, Automobile, Electrical, Electronics & Communication and Civil Engineering braches.

Computer Science and IT branches leads campus placements at CU

Computer Science Engineering students of University Institute of Engineering (UIE) created history as Top Multi-National offered highest package of Rs. 35 lacs for the Engineering branch. IT giants such as Microsoft, IBM, SAP Labs, Hewlett Packard visited CU and recruited more than 2030 CSE/IT Engineering students. World‚Äôs top IT giant Microsoft selected Computer Science and IT Engineering students consecutively for last three years, while number the selections have increased three times and touched 15.

India‚Äôs leading IT Company Wipro (394), Capgemini (217), Mindtree (101) while the global IT giant IBM also selected record number of 196 engineering students which is highest number of selections made in any campus in North India.

Chandigarh University Common Entrance Test

CUCET is a National level online entrance test conducted by NAAC A+ accredited Chandigarh University. It is a mandatory test for acceptance into UG programs of Engineering, Pharmacy, Agriculture and Integrated Law, and MBA.

CUCET 2021 was launched by the Honorable Minister of Education Shri Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank Ji. With the idea of investing in talent, CUCET offers promising students with incredible financial assistance.

Question: What are the pros and cons of KJ Somaiya engineering?
Answer:
K.J somaiya college of Engineering is an Engineering college with special seats for Gujrati Minority located in Vidyavihar.

Pros:-

One of the biggest advantage of this college its that it is an Autonomous college!! So they are more good and updated with their syllabus compared to MUMBAI UNIVERSITY students.
Wider opportunities as there are many Organizations and councils like Orion Racing, Bloombox, Emfinity,etc
The campus is probably one of the biggest in Mumbai besides IIT BOMBAY having various sport fields .
Good placement opportunities
Labs are having facilities and instruments which most college in MU doesn't have!

Cons:-

Infrastructure needs to be more developed. (Lack of AC's, good furniture).
You will find some teachers who are good with their job but some who are terrible at it at every college and same is the scenario over here. At the end of the day it's effort from your own side.
